definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover

sentences.english: Herren says pirated goods are a growth industry.
sentences.chinese: 海倫表示，製造仿冒產品是一個不斷擴張的產業。

sentences.english: King Trading is making knockoffs of our TV sets and selling them.
sentences.chinese: 金氏貿易公司仿冒我們的電視機並且上市銷售。

sentences.english: So it's easy to understand why consumers might opt for the lower-cost counterfeit.
sentences.chinese: 這就是消費者爲何選擇低成本的仿冒品的原因了。

sentences.english: Typo pirates play on the names of famous sites to collect authentication and registration information.
sentences.chinese: 通過仿冒著名站點的名稱來收集認證和註冊信息。

sentences.english: All the goods were knock-offs, of course.
sentences.chinese: 當然，所有的產品都是仿冒的。

sentences.english: These are rip-off brand sneakers. No wonder they are worn out so quickly.
sentences.chinese: 我買到了仿冒的名牌球鞋，難怪這麼快就穿壞了。

sentences.english: Are you worried about all the sample-sale copycats?
sentences.chinese: 你是否爲所有樣品銷售的仿冒者感到煩惱？

sentences.english: Most of these improvements came in the form of upgrades to surface and side materials, which would clearly distinguish authentic shoes from knockoffs.
sentences.chinese: 這些改進可以從裏到外的使正品大大區別於仿冒品。

sentences.english: The message digest is like a watermark that cannot be counterfeited.
sentences.chinese: 訊息摘要如同不能被仿冒的浮水印。

sentences.english: I assured them I would never buy imitations.
sentences.chinese: 我向他們保證自己不會去買仿冒品。

definition: to impersonate/to pose as (someone else)/to counterfeit/to palm off (a fake as a genuine)
to counterfeit/to pass off a fake as genuine
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
to feign/to pretend to be/to pass oneself off as
